entry.def: If a government or other authority expropriates someone's property, they take it away from them for public use.

example.ex: The Bolsheviks expropriated the property of the landowners.
example.tran: 布尔什维克征收了地主的财产。

means.word_mean: 1. taking out of an owner's hands (especially taking property by public authority)

auth_sentence.content: The policy of expropriation has created fear and uncertainty amongst property owners.
auth_sentence.res_content: The policy of expropriation has created fear and uncertainty amongst property owners.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The policy of expropriation has created fear and uncertainty amongst property owners.

auth_sentence.content: It is very worrying that expropriation of private sector capital is taking place.
auth_sentence.res_content: It is very worrying that expropriation of private sector capital is taking place.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is very worrying that expropriation of private sector capital is taking place.

auth_sentence.content: September - Government begins the expropriation of white-owned farms as part of a land-reform programme.
auth_sentence.res_content: September - Government begins the expropriation of white-owned farms as part of a land-reform programme.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: September - Government begins the expropriation of white-owned farms as part of a land-reform programme.
